root.para: Financial instruments are susceptible to , which is defined in paragraph .07 of AU-C section 540B as "[t]he susceptibility of an accounting estimate and related disclosures to an inherent lack of precision in its measurement." Estimation uncertainty is affected by the complexity of financial instruments, among other factors. The nature and reliability of information available to support the measurement of financial instruments varies widely, which affects the estimation uncertainty associated with their measurement. This Audit Guide uses the term to refer to the estimation uncertainty associated with fair value measurements. estimation uncertainty measurement uncertainty
